p: To date the 3D structure of TMPRSS2 has not been experimentally determined, and thus, we have used SWISS-MODEL [ 32] webserver ( https://swissmodel.expasy.org/interactive) to perform homology modeling of TMPRSS2. We submitted the TMPRSS2 protein sequence (NCBI reference sequence NP_005647.3) to SWISS-MODEL and selected the crystal structure of human protein hepsin (PDB 1Z8G) [ 72] as the template to build the model structure ( Figure 2a). Note that hepsin (PDB 1Z8G) is also a Type II transmembrane trypsin-like serine protease, and it shares 38% sequence similarity with TMPRSS2 (NP_005647.3) ( Figure 2b). Subsequently, UCSF Chimera [ 33] was used to minimize the energy of the TMPRSS2 model structure obtained from SWISS-MODEL. Thereafter, the energy-minimized TMPRSS2 model structure was assessed using the structure assessment tool within SWISS-MODEL. In the TMPRSS2 model, 94.19% of the amino acid residues were found to be in the Ramachandran favoured regions in the Ramachandran plot ( Figure 2c) and the model structure has a MolProbity [ 73] score of 1.50.
